moves.5... Qd4: This queen move could have been premature - but I liked it because it seemed aggressive.
moves.6... Qxe4+: I capture his pawn with check. I can force him to move his king now, preventing castling.
moves.7... Qxe2+: I exchange, forcing the King to move.
moves.9. Re1: White prepares to "castle manually", with the threat of a discovered check.
moves.9... O-O-O: I castle out of the way.
moves.10. d3: Opening a line for his bishop.
moves.11. Be3: Prevents a check on his king. Not sure if this is the best square for the bishop though - ...Re8 pins it.
moves.11... Bd6: I connect my rooks by moving my bishop out of the way.
moves.12. Nbd2: White develops his knight, protecting against ...Bxf2 followed by the loss of the h2 pawn. Looks quite cramped around his king now.
moves.13. Kf1: White moves his king out of the way.
moves.13... Nd5: I push my knight forward to avoid it being pinned against my rook by Bg5.
moves.14. Ng5: Threatening to take one of my pawns (h7 or f7).
moves.14... f6: Now if white does take h7, his knight becomes stuck.
moves.15. Nf7: So instead he threatens my rook. The knight is unsupported now though.
moves.16. Nxd6+: White takes my bishop with check.
moves.17... Nb4: I threaten his pawn on d3 - or to fork his rooks with Nc2.
moves.18. Bb6: White threatens mate if I don't watch it... (19. Rxe8+ Rd8 20. Rxd8#)
moves.19... Rxe7: But now I have control of the e-file.
moves.21. Ne4: White threatens my pawn on d6.
moves.22. Nc5+: On the surface, this tactic looks like it wins a pawn for white after ...dxc5 (23.) Bxc5... forking my knight and rook. I go along with it, because if you look further there is now a problem for white...
moves.23. Bxc5: White attacks my rook and knight...
moves.23... Nc2: But now white's rook is attacked too - and I have his knight for a pawn.
moves.24... Bxd3+: I take a pawn with check, and protect my knight too.
moves.25... Re2+: I check him again, moving my rook to safety.
moves.26... Re1: I force a trade of rooks.
moves.27... Nxe1: I take back - and I am up in material.
moves.28. b3: Attempts to strengthen his pawn structure.
moves.28... Bb1:
But now my bishop can pick at least one of them off. White graciously resigns. (Based on our relative ratings, white could probably have played on and waited for a mistake on my part!)
